description.narrative: The Community Forestry Program (CFP) will be implemented in 15 districts including conflict-affected areas in North and East, benefiting 90,000 people with forestry and forestry related activities. CFP will also improve forest cover of 23,000 hectares in the dry and intermediate zones in order to protect and promote the biodiversity of selected areas. The Community Forestry Management (CFM) approach is a process in which a community is mobilised; natural resource management options and priorities identified; and government and/or private sector resources mobilised to implement the priorities. The CFM approach recognises the economic alternatives are necessary if communities are to stop exploiting the forest or Chena cultivation (slash and burn) in forest areas. The CFM approach also recognises that the communities are themselves in the best position to protect the forest from illegal or unsustainable practices. The total value of this initiative is $5.0 million over five years, startin
